Chaicode Teas

  • Masala Chai

    Traditional Indian tea brewed with black tea, milk, sugar, and aromatic spices like cardamom, ginger, cloves, and cinnamon.

  • Ginger Chai

    A strong tea flavored with fresh ginger, ideal for digestion and warmth.

  • Cardamom Chai

    Black tea brewed with crushed cardamom pods, giving it a sweet and fragrant flavor.

  • Tulsi Chai

    Herbal tea infused with holy basil (tulsi), known for its immunity-boosting and stress-relieving properties.

  • Adrak Elaichi Chai

    A popular North Indian tea with both ginger (adrak) and cardamom (elaichi) for a spicy-sweet taste.

  • Kesar Chai

    Saffron-infused tea that adds a rich aroma and royal flavor, often consumed during special occasions.

  • Lemon Chai

    A light, tangy tea without milk, made with lemon juice, black tea, and sometimes honey or spices.

  • Kashmiri Kahwa

    A green tea from Kashmir blended with saffron, almonds, cinnamon, and cardamom.

  • Tandoori Chai

    Chai poured into hot clay cups (kulhads), creating a smoky flavor unique to this preparation style.

  • Irani Chai

    A creamy, sweet tea with origins in Persian cafes of Hyderabad, often served with biscuits or bun maska.
